alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Decatur, Grady and Thomas Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whigham to 11 miles southwest of Cairo to near Havana. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cairo, Thomasville, Bainbridge, Boston, Ochlocknee, Pavo, Whigham, Attapulgus, Barwick, Climax, Thomasville Municipal A/P, Capel, Dillon, Everett, Rocky Hill, Merrillville, Laingkat, Calvary, Princes Still and Peoples Still. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southwestern Georgia.
